alert.note: Alert for Pulaski (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 31 at 8:20PM CDT until March 31 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR PULASKI COUNTY... At 819 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Dongola, or 14 miles southeast of Anna, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Karnak around 830 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include New Grand Chain, Ullin, Olmsted and Pulaski. This includes Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 5 and 21. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
